ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: or reminded, and the reminder benefit him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Or be admonished, and the admonition profit him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: or he might be mindful and good counsel might avail him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: or receive some (Quranic) advice which would benefit him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Or that he may accept advice, so the advice may benefit him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Or he might receive admonition, and the admonition might profit him
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Or become reminded so that the reminder should profit him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: or yet remember, and the Reminder profit him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Or take heed and so the reminder might avail him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: or take heed and derive benefit from [Our] warning?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Or be admonished, so that the admonition might have profited him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: or take admonition, and the admonition would benefit him!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Or that he might receive admonition, and the teaching might profit him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Or that he might receive admonition, and that the admonition might profit him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: (He might) remember, and the Reminder might profit him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Or be reminded, and the message would benefit him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Or be reminded and the remembrance would benefit him?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [80:4] or be admonished (yadhdhakkar: the original tā’ [of yatadhakkar] has been assimilated with the dhāl) and so the reminder, the admonition heard from you, might benefit him (a variant reading [for tanfa‘uhu] has tanfa‘ahu as the response to the optative statement).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Or take heed) by means of the Qur'an (and so the reminder) by means of the Qur'an (might avail him?) It is also said that this means: how do you know O Muhammad, whether or not he becomes righteous and whether or not he benefits from the admonitions of the Qur'an.
